physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No acute findings on physical examination. Elevated aspartate aminotransferase: 960 U/liter, alanine aminotransferase: 347 U/liter. Slightly elevated white blood cell count: 13,300/mm3 (which normalized in 2 days).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Liver function tests 2 months prior were normal (aspartate and alanine aminotransferase levels: 19 U/liter). After discontinuing lamotrigine, aspartate aminotransferase levels returned to normal range within 5 days, and alanine aminotransferase levels remained mildly elevated at 102 U/liter.
